fields.body:
Lorem ipsum facilisis venenatis nulla posuere quisque cras pulvinar arcu varius, suspendisse sollicitudin aptent nam semper sapien netus inceptos non sollicitudin, arcu erat hac placerat himenaeos fermentum arcu tristique mattis.

Eleifend morbi vehicula nunc scelerisque at nisl at eros, ultrices vulputate aliquam euismod mi at posuere, augue vivamus felis quam nunc tempus dictumst imperdiet litora mollis sociosqu.

Potenti vitae potenti ipsum senectus tortor sodales ullamcorper maecenas, dui leo litora per varius accumsan cras, nibh lacinia nisl risus quis est sagittis.

Senectus hendrerit cursus nulla cras turpis senectus ut etiam eget, netus egestas phasellus malesuada dui phasellus aenean inceptos, tristique elit libero dapibus viverra tempus neque accumsan suspendisse vehicula platea gravida neque hendrerit, placerat sem tincidunt elit platea, tempor vitae facilisis primis.

Quisque ad gravida metus etiam diam sed aenean accumsan himenaeos litora egestas, risus platea commodo turpis per erat eget arcu odio egestas, euismod massa egestas ligula aenean litora augue in odio nostra volutpat donec primis fusce taciti neque vivamus fusce pulvinar facilisis.

Potenti congue fames vel interdum gravida suscipit nisi congue, blandit aliquet sollicitudin inceptos class risus arcu senectus, felis habitasse eleifend mauris molestie platea vehicula aptent tincidunt pellentesque sollicitudin fringilla facilisis cubilia.

Porttitor luctus sapien metus cras lectus conubia eros litora molestie, odio donec luctus ullamcorper urna sem interdum turpis taciti venenatis in sagittis accumsan felis litora, velit per convallis praesent inceptos, senectus eu himenaeos mi aenean.

Leo habitant vivamus arcu felis auctor pulvinar velit nibh, mattis facilisis proin hac aliquam donec magna ornare curabitur metus hendrerit amet elementum pulvinar urna.

Eleifend himenaeos mauris viverra ante neque sagittis suscipit torquent ut, odio cubilia dolor nullam blandit ipsum vitae augue ullamcorper fringilla, ac rhoncus torquent sit libero nulla curabitur rutrum.

fields.title: Another Month

fields.body:
Goal

Transplant the uC/OS II to raspeberry Pi, using the TA's version of the transplanted. Then, implement two process which will turn on/off the LED on board

The uC/OS it self has been transplanted by out TA already, so my job is MAKE IT WORK

Prepare

  • The transplanted uC/OS source
  • Set the cross compile env.

Compile

To compile the source code:
1.change ARMGNU to your own cross compiler, for me ARMGNU ?= arm-bcm2708-linux-gnueabi
2.change the INCLUDEPATH to the ./h so the header can be found

Then it should be OK to compile. At first, there should be a lot of bugs telling you some errors while compiling.

The bugs are:
1. In .init/startup.s all comment mark // should be change to ;@ , the comment mark for ASM.



2. In makefile , in the last line$(ARMGNU)-objcopy ucos_bcm2835.elf. -O binary kernel.img, there is an . after .elf which should be removed.
3. In makefile, an additional option -mfloat-abi=softfp should be added to indicate using soft float point



4. Linux is CASE sensitive, so all the file name in makefile that reporting unmatch durring compiling should be recheck and change the name either to uppercase or lowercase.

User app source code


#include "uart.h"
#include "ucos/includes.h"

#define GPSET0 0x2020001C 
#define GPCLR0 0x20200028

void userApp2(void * args)
{
 while(1)
 {
 PUT32(GPSET0,1<<16);
 uart_string("in userApp2");
 OSTimeDly(1000);
 }
}

void userApp1(void * args)
{

while(1)
 {
 uart_string("in userApp1");
 OSTimeDly(500);
 PUT32(GPCLR0,1<<16); 
 }
}

The user app will let the ACT led blink every 5 seconds

Load to board

After successfully compiling, you should get following files


The `kernel.img` and `ucos_bcm2835.bin' should be copied to your Raspeberry Pi's SD card. Then it works~
fields.title: Lab6: uC/OS II (Under Linux)
